title: Blackletter: Type and National Identity
content:
Two Books and One Exhibition.

Edited and curated by [Peter Bain](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414212218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%20Bain) and [Paul Shaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414212218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Paul%20Shaw).

The books/exhibition deal with the history of [Blackletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414212218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Blackletter) typefaces, the nationalist tendencies that became associated with them, and those typefaces that were intended to embody this.

The first monograph, published by Princeton Architectural Press, is a series of essays contributed by authors such as Hans Peter Willberg and Christopher Burke; the second book is the exhibition catalogue, published by the American Printing History Association as part of its journal _Printing History_. Copies of the monograph are available from [Peter Bain](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414212218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%20Bain) and [Paul Shaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414212218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Paul%20Shaw).

The exhibition was held in 1998 at the Herb Lubalin Study Center of Design and Typography at [Cooper Union](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414212218/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cooper%20Union).
author: dan_reynolds
